title: A Busy End to the Semester and Start of Summer
author: Ciaran Shaughnessy
summary: Quarterly update covering undergraduate research successes, lab dinner, NASCE conference, and welcoming Susanne.
content:
Undergraduate Research Sucesses | Another year has come to a close...

All of my undergraduate researchers have done a fantastic job this year!

Welcoming Susanne | Susanne Hahs is joining us for an M.S. after recently graduating from Boston College...

A Full Lab this Summer | This summer, the Shaughnessy Lab has 6 people working in the lab on research assistantships...

NASCE | Allison and I traveled to Québec City for the North American Society of Comparative Endocrinologists (NASCE)...
imageCaption: Kristine presenting her research at the Karen L. Smith Undergraduate Research Symposium.

title: Functionally divergent melanocortin receptor subtypes and the HPI axis in sea lamprey
author: Ciaran Shaughnessy
summary: New paper in J Mol Endocrinol examining melanocortin receptor divergence in sea lamprey.
content: New Paper in J Mol Endocrinol! This was my first time putting our work in this journal...
imageCaption: J Mol Endocrinol lamprey HPI axis paper

title: A Cftr-independent, Ano1-rich seawater-adaptive ionocyte in sea lamprey gills
author: Ciaran Shaughnessy
summary: Paper in JEB reporting absence of CFTR in SW ionocyte in lamprey.
content: I cannot describe how relieved I am to have this work out there finally...

title: Physiological and morphological traits affect contemporary range expansion in an amphibian species
author: Ciaran Shaughnessy
summary: Co-authored paper in J Anim Ecol exploring traits driving frog range expansion.
content: I was happy to play a minor part of this manuscript of Owen's...
